src:
Protes Korupsi, Warga Kuwait Serukan Pemerintah Berhenti Curi Uang Publik
07 Nov 2019, 10:17 by Rita Uli Hutapea
Kuwait City - Warga Kuwait menggelar aksi demo di depan gedung parlemen negeri itu untuk memprotes dugaan korupsi pemerintah dan buruknya layanan publik. Para demonstran juga menuntut pengunduran diri ketua parlemen Marzouq al-Ghanim yang dituduh korupsi oleh para anggota parlemen lainnya.
"Mundur! Mundur, Marzouq, rakyat Kuwait tidak menginginkan Anda," teriak ribuan demonstran dalam aksi mereka di Lapangan Al-Erada yang berada di seberang gedung parlemen di ibu kota Kuwait City pada Rabu (6/11/2019).
Aksi demo ini digerakkan oleh mantan anggota parlemen, Saleh al-Moulla yang menggunakan media sosial untuk menyerukan aksi damai di bawah slogan "Cukup sudah!"
Kepada para wartawan seperti dilansir kantor berita AFP, Kamis (7/11/2019), Moulla mengatakan bahwa aksi ini merupakan "pesan dari rakyat dan ungkapan ketidaksenangan rakyat menghadapi korupsi."
text:
Corruption Protests, Kuwaiti Citizens Call on the Government to Stop Stealing Public Money
Nov 7 2019, 10:17 by Rita Uli Hutapea
Kuwait City - Kuwaitis hold a demonstration in front of the country's parliament to protest the government's alleged corruption and poor public services. The demonstrators also demanded the resignation of parliamentary speaker Marzouq al-Ghanim who was accused of corruption by other lawmakers.
"Back off! Back off, Marzouq, Kuwaiti people don't want you," shouted thousands of demonstrators in their action at Al-Erada Square, opposite the parliament building in the capital city of Kuwait City on Wednesday (6/11/2019).
The demonstration was driven by former MPs, Saleh al-Moulla who used social media to call for peaceful action under the slogan "Enough!"
To journalists as reported by the AFP news agency on Thursday (11/07/2019), Moulla said that this action was "a message from the people and an expression of people's displeasure in facing corruption."
